title: Do fat people buy lots?
content:
Do you think that it is fat people who buy a disproportionate amount of goods, and would that mean that they support the ecconomy or are responsible for our problems as a consumer driven society?A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Do fat people buy lots?
content: People that are fat may buy more food products (candy, ice cream, hamburgers..) than the non-fat people, but the non-fat people spend a lot more money to all kinds of stuff. They buy the latest clothes (shirt 100 dollars, jeans 100 dollars etc..) every month, buy the latest technology, fast cars, and just consume everything like maniacs. I'd say they (non-fat) are the ones to blame instead.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Do fat people buy lots?
content:
Answer an either or question with a yes or no... I don't know which way I was voting when I voted.

I believe that fat people do buy lots. I work at Pretzel Time in the local mall and I see fat people sometimes buy the same amount of crap as skinny people do... it is just that the fat people order a diet (light) coke instead of a regular. More often than not though, fat people DO buy a lot. Like enough food that would make an average person sick. It makes me sick thinking about how one person can eat all that.

But weather they support the economy more is unknown. Fat people are more at risk for diseases such as diabetes and various types of cancer. This is causing billions of dollars (The problem only seems to be in the US.) to be poured into medical research. This in turn produces pills which have nasty horrible side effects. And when fat people do get sick they have to spend lots of money on medical treatment. Is this helping the economy? I don't think it is helping society.-----------------------
"Tough guys wear pink"
[img]http://img455.imageshack.us/img455/8978/mod21gb.jpg[/img]
"But fat people STILL buy lots"

title: Re: Do fat people buy lots?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]
People that are fat may buy more food products (candy, ice cream, hamburgers..) than the non-fat people, but the non-fat people spend a lot more money to all kinds of stuff. They buy the latest clothes (shirt 100 dollars, jeans 100 dollars etc..) every month, buy the latest technology, fast cars, and just consume everything like maniacs. I'd say they (non-fat) are the ones to blame instead.
[hr][/quote]

A. Okay, this topic is utter ignorance. I know people who go out and eat an entire pizza and are skinny as hell. I know people who eat health food and are fat.

B. Fat has more to do with genes than what you eat.

C. They don't hurt or help the economy any more than skinny people. For instance, buying McDonalds is not very expensive, but it can help get you obese.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Do fat people buy lots?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Fat has more to do with genes than what you eat.[hr][/quote]

So suddenly some kind of fat gene is infecting America? Or maybe the population evolved fat in the previous decade.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Do fat people buy lots?
content: Don't forget excersize. Fad diets aren't the only way (or even the best way) to get thin, you know.

title: Re: Do fat people buy lots?
content:
Well... America has more fat people, and we spend more...

Im tired, so I am not sure...Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/LLMod.jpg[/img]
"Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!"
-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Do fat people buy lots?
content: The American fatness is just perverse, I can't understand how someone can develop the 300+ kilograms.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Do fat people buy lots?
content:
Depends on the person.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-spotkeen.gif[/img] Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey
"I always try to consume interesting animals."-LevelLord

title: People. Bye.
content:
I'm with Glo on this one. I'm the complete opposite of fat, and I spend money as often as I can.

I have no sympathy for those who go out and impulsively buy stupid shit they don't need and/or purchase things that (they think) other people expect/want them to buy, then complain they never have enough money. I know one beefy person who matches this description, but I also know many thin people (many of whom consider themselves fat--go figure) who have similar patterns. The fact is, people buy lots, and people don't buy lots.

As for the economy, well makes no little sense as it is without factoring in fat people, so I'll leave that discussion well alone. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

content:

title: Re: People. Bye.
content:
OH MY GOD! It worked! I can't believe my brain transplant actually WORKED! Unfortunately people might notice now... and I thought switching the brains of two noobs would be inconspicuous...

[quote]Quote:[hr]So suddenly some kind of fat gene is infecting America?[hr][/quote]
You didn't hear? People who have fat parents ALWAYS turn out rather large themselves. I mean take ME for example. My parents are both fat and I weigh in at an extremely heavy 130 LBS. I mean come on, what more proof do you need.

I heard that the amount of obese people who's weight is a problem because of genes is 1 in 10. AND keep in mind that this is OBESE people and not just "fat" people. Personally I think that the statistic should be even lower.

Also another point I have is exercise. When I found myself getting some fat on my stomach last January, (It was from Christmas cookies I bet.) I started doing push ups and sit ups and running. I lost all the fat and kept working out all the way up until my wisdom teeth operation. I stopped working out but I think I need to start again. Anyway my point is, It doesn't matter if you might be more "At risk" of being fat because your parents are, what matters is that you take personal responsibility for your body and do what needs to be done to take care of it. This is like saying "I will get cavities because my brother got cavities." If you don't take care of your teeth then, yes you probably WILL get cavities. If you don't take care of your body then, yes you probably WILL get fat.

Although this entire post will probably get skipped because it is too long for the male attention span, [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] and because it goes way off topic from what this thread is originally about.-----------------------
"Tough guys wear pink"
[img]http://img455.imageshack.us/img455/8978/mod21gb.jpg[/img]
"But fat people STILL buy lots"

title: Re: People. Bye.
content:
Good post! I enjoyed it!

[quote]Quote:[hr]You didn't hear? People who have fat parents ALWAYS turn out rather large themselves. I mean take ME for example. My parents are both fat and I weigh in at an extremely heavy 130 LBS. I mean come on, what more proof do you need.[hr][/quote]

You mean, if you grow up with irresponsible parents that never teach you to eat healthy food, pass their bad eating habits onto you and generally set a bad example...

its all down to genes? Astounding! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Also another point I have is exercise.[hr][/quote]

Heh, my mom wanted to loose wegight too, she started exercising, and weight 7Kg more now. [All muscle mass, she can actually bench press my father.]

Also another point I have is exercise. When I found myself getting some fat on my stomach last January, (It was from Christmas cookies I bet.) I started doing push ups and sit ups and running.
